desc.main:
Starting as an Android developer back in 2017, I am a passionate developer specializing in deployment of ML models in Android apps. Alongside development, I'm an active member on StackOverflow and frequent writer on Medium, writing primarily on ML, Math and Android. Lately, I am exploring ML with Rust, C and C++ alongside backend technologies in Java/Kotlin.

I adore simplicity and conciseness while developing software.
desc.blogs: Topics spanning ML, Mathematics and Android Development
desc.work_exp: Working with Android, ML frameworks and backend technologies

education.desc: Coursework includes object-oriented programming, computer networks, low-level programming, DBMS, data science and data-structures

blogs.title: From Python To Android: HF Sentence Transformers (Embeddings)
WebAssembly: Everything You Need To Know
On-Device Machine Learning In Android: Frameworks and Ecosystem
Using C/C++ in Android: A Comprehensive Guide For Beginners
Building A Cross-Platform TFIDF Text Summarizer In Rust
Kernels: Everything You Need to Know
Principal Component Analysis: Everything You Need To Know
Empirical Distribution: Everything You Need To Know
Deploying Scikit-Learn Models In Android Apps With ONNX
No, Kernels & Filters Are Not The Same
Creating Desktop Apps For TensorFlow Models With Qt
Chaquopy: Using Python In Android Apps
Managing Deep Learning Models Easily With TOML Configurations
Accessing App Usage History In Android
Deploying Pretrained TF Object Detection Models on Android

work_experience.desc: Developed ML inference systems for physiological data
Conducted experiments on various approaches for gender/ethnicity detection from iris images (datasets like NDIRIS and GFI)
Deployed a custom trained TF Object Detection model in an Android annotated with labels for determining the age and gender of customers in a supermarket

Developed a system for determining similarity between two given texts, using Word2Vec. The system's performance was improved with just-in-compilation (accomplished with Numba) and multiprocessing in Python

ClearSky is a Switzerland-based startup aiming to bring cloud/server-free ML-based services for customers. Built a speech-to-text app that would record calls automatically in an Android app and transcribe them as meeting notes

Worked as an Android Development Intern with AjnaLens, a tech startup that creates augmented reality headsets for use in education and defence. Integrated various ML models in Android apps and also improved their efficiency for Android apps. Worked with 3rd-party libraries that would integrate a hardware component with an Android app

projects.name: Face Recognition and Classification With FaceNet On Android
projects.sub: Kotlin, Jetpack Compose, CameraX, TF Lite, MLKit and Coroutines
projects.desc: On-device face recognition with FaceNet and TF Lite. It uses images stored on the device's storage and identifies subjects from the camera preview. It uses an optimized pipeline written in C++ to process embeddings and display results

projects.name: Age + Gender Estimation on Android with TensorFlow Lite
projects.desc: On-device age and gender estimation from user-selected images, with a Keras model designed and trained on a Google Colab notebook

projects.name: Sentence-Embeddings-Android
projects.desc: Embeddings from sentence-transformers in Android - Uses all-MiniLM-L6-V2 model currently

projects.name: Depth-Anything Android App
projects.desc: Inference of the popular Depth-Anything V1/V2 models on Android, using ONNX Runtime. Depth-Anything is a SOTA ML model for monocular depth-estimation from images.

projects.name: Android-Document-QA
projects.desc: An Android app that performs document question-answering on-device, with a built-in vector database (ObjectBox), embedding model (Sentence-Embeddings) and Gemini API

projects.name: postagger.rs
projects.desc: NLTK inspired Parts-of-Speech Tagger (Perceptron Tagger) in Rust, with wrappers in Java and C

projects.name: glove.c
projects.desc: A port of GloVe word embeddings written in C, with wrappers in Java and Python. It uses a hashtable with open-chaining to store (word,index) pairs and provides methods for comparing semantic similarity between two words using cosine and L2-norm

projects.name: tfidf-summarizer.rs
projects.desc: Implementation of an extractive text summarization system in Rust, which uses TF-IDF scores of words present in the text to rank sentences and generate a summary. It has wrappers in C and Android, and can use the Rayon crate to generate summaries by utilizing multiple CPU cores

projects.name: Full Text Search in Java
projects.desc: A full-text-search command-line utility built for PDFs, DOCX using inverted index, that given a query, returns a list of documents containing the query tokens in O(1) time

projects.name: Backend for a Blogpost App
projects.desc: A set of REST APIs built in FastAPI for a blogpost application. It includes MySQL database connectivity, deployment with Docker Compose, rate limiting and JWT authentication.

projects.name: InC Project Management Backend
projects.desc: InC is an annual technical exhibition hosted by PICT where students showcase their technical projects to a bench of judges. We built a backend with Ktor and MySQL which provides useful REST services to organizers, such like checking team-escort allotment and team-judge allocation, that were initially carried out in spread-sheets.

projects.name: Decoder-only Transformer for Language Modelling in PyTorch
projects.desc: A decoder-only transformer (auto-regressive) built from scratch in PyTorch and trained on the WikiHow dataset for language generation. The model was deployed with FastAPI and Streamlit, inspired from karpathy/nanoGPT

projects.name: Monocular Depth Estimation using MiDaS in Android
projects.desc: An Android app which uses the MiDaS model to perform monocular depth estimation on raw camera frames
